description: Tensor Network Error Mitigation (TEM) represents the noise channel of a quantum circuit as a matrix product operator (MPO) and applies its inverse to noisy measurement outcomes. The tensor network structure captures spatially and temporally correlated noise with polynomial complexity.

The method was proposed by Guo and Yang (2022) using variational MPO inversion, and extended by Filippov et al. (2023) with a scalable algorithm that achieves provably optimal sampling overhead among linear mitigation methods.
TEM is particularly well-suited for circuits with spatially structured noise, where the MPO bond dimension remains moderate. It has been implemented as a commercial Qiskit function by Algorithmiq.
how_it_works: Characterize the noise channel of the quantum circuit as a matrix product operator (MPO) using tomographic data or noise models.
Compute the inverse of the MPO noise channel, either variationally or analytically.
Execute the noisy circuit with informationally complete measurements.
Apply the MPO inverse to the measurement outcomes in classical post-processing.
Extract mitigated expectation values from the corrected state representation.

key_equations.label: MPO noise representation
key_equations.latex: \mathcal{N} = \sum_{\{i_k, j_k\}} \operatorname{tr}(A_1^{i_1 j_1} A_2^{i_2 j_2} \cdots A_n^{i_n j_n}) |i_1 \cdots i_n\rangle\langle j_1 \cdots j_n|

bias_variance.notes: Unbiased if the MPO noise model is exact. Sampling overhead is optimal among linear mitigation methods. Overhead scales with MPO bond dimension.

advantages: Captures spatially and temporally correlated noise
Provably optimal sampling overhead among linear mitigation methods
Polynomial complexity in bond dimension (avoids exponential scaling)
Robust against changes in circuit size and depth
Available as a commercial Qiskit function (Algorithmiq)
disadvantages: Accuracy depends on MPO bond dimension capturing the noise structure
Noise characterization overhead for learning the MPO
Variance can be significant for highly correlated noise requiring large bond dimension
use_cases: Circuits with spatially correlated noise on multi-qubit processors
Settings where PEC sampling overhead is prohibitive
Large-scale quantum computations requiring scalable mitigation
